name: Quirinale Hotel

reviews.text: The personnel are very helpful and accommodating. The location is great, centrally located, but not clogged with traffic. I loved having breakfast in the garden and drinks in the grand lobby. The place feels like an 19th century palace, complete with paintings in the public spaces.
reviews.title: Ten years Returning to the Same Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well, the location is good, the price could be better, but the tones of died, dried flies between windows are unacceptable! How can you enjoy staing in a relatively good hotel knowing that nobody bothers to wipe out dust etc.
reviews.title: With a nice atmosphere... and dirt

reviews.text: Not a US 5-star chain hotel...accept the fact that things are different in Europe than Cleveland...everything you need, spacious rooms and walking distance to anything you need. A good place to begin your Italian sojourn...
reviews.title: Old World Charm and central location...all good!

reviews.text: The hotel is very elegant and classic. It was very quiet when we stayed and not much atmosphere. The restaurant is quite restrained. But we got excellent value.
reviews.title: Very elegant hotel

reviews.text: This hotel is on the Via Nazionale, quite near to Rome's main train station and about 40 mins drive from the Fumicino airport. It's in a good location in a safe part of Rome, about 15 mins walk from the Trevi fountain and other popular tourist sites - the Collosseum is just down the road (turn left out the hotel, then turn left on via Serpenti and you'll see it in front of you). The Parthenon and Spanish Steps are walkable as well, and I took a stroll up to the Villa Medici on a nice sunny morning during my stay.
reviews.title: Good choice for business or leisure in Rome

reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights this summer. Beautiful hotel. Room and bathroom were very large. Breakfast buffet was great with a lot of choices. Very nice courtyard to eat breakfast at. Very good location - tons of restaurants and gelato shops and a short walk to the Trevi and Spanish steps.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: We went to this hotel because my grandfather used to go there very often many years ago, even my mother knew it and recommended it to us, even though she hadn't gone there for a very long time.
reviews.title: Old hotel, many memories

reviews.text: Yes, it is a very old hotel, yet very classy and clean
reviews.title: good hotel but the lobby need an upgrade

reviews.text: The location is great, you can go from there walking all around Rome. Transportation available.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay and great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great breakfast, great service.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel
Ignore idiot reviews
reviews.text: This hotel is older, but that only means rooms that are larger and much more comfortable than newer European and Italian hotels. The location is fabulous for touring the ruins and museums. The staff was helpful and efficient, even if they did not try to be our close personal friends, HIV other reviewers seem o expect. Now for the idiots. Those who omplain of " pay tv only" do not know how to operate a remote. There is a TV button to push because the tv starts by default at the pay movie menu (just like U.S. hotels!). Likewise, the wifi internet requires a device-specific code. Then itworks fine. The room service was actually good, when our son wanted a late night snack. This place was a great value and we would gladly come back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Before yourip a place, please use your brain.
reviews.title: Looking for a good central hotel?

reviews.text: Just back from a 4-days trip to Rome: We stayed in the Quirinal: A great hotel. It took only approx. 10 minutes walk from Termini to the hotel where we were welcome by a friendly and helpful staff. The decor of the hotel and room was like one of an old Roman palace to a high standard. We had a room facing the garden which was pretty quite and we could leave the windows open (one downfall: it was pretty warm in the room). Qurinale is perfectly located for sightseeing: bus stop right in front and underground 5 minutes away only. Restaurants across the street offer pizza and pasta at reasonable prices. My husband and I will definately return and will recommend the hotel to other friends.
reviews.title: Good central hotel

reviews.text: Just back from Rome and this hotel was lovely. Old so very in fitting with the surroundings and decor to a high standard. Right next to train and metro so very good location. Good restaurants near buy and easy to get to all the sites. Only downfall was that the rooms were very warm (and I'm usually cold!) they have the cold air from the aircon turned off in winter but really needs to be kept on. You can open the windows but too much traffic noise to keep open at night. This would not stop me returning to this hotel though!!
reviews.title: Roman holiday

reviews.text: Six of us stayed in the excellent Quirinale in Feb 2012. Location is perfect for a holiday in Rome. The bus termini is about 5 or 10 minutes away - and there is a bus stop right outside the hotel. The restaurants in the immediate area are very good and there are two Irish pubs on the street.
reviews.title: A fading hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Quirinale February 10 - 12, 2012. I absolutely loved it! The hotel has the old world charm that a hotel in Rome should have. My room was large with a high ceiling, with a huge bed and proper antique furnishings. The flat screen tv looked out of place. The bathroom had a massive sink and massive cast iron roll top bath. The bath was so big that I floated away when I leaned back!! If you want white walls and minimalist furnishings, this isn't the place for you. If you want old world elegance, then book it now. I, for one, cannot wait to stay here again. Nearly forgot to mention the staff!, who were all absolutely wonderful and couldn't do enough for us.
reviews.title: Elegant, old world charm.

reviews.text: Lovely Hotel, staff very friendly and helpful, rooms large and comfortable, bath and shower in our bathroom, plenty of towels. Breakfast excellent, buffet style with lots of choices, set us up for the day. We stayed as a party of 4 friends to go too the Rugby and also to celebrate a 60th Birthday, we all had a great break.
reviews.title: Rugby and a Birthday in Rome

reviews.text: Massive pile of a place in a fantasitc location - about 10 minutes from Termini, and an easy walk to the sights, good service from the staff, decent breakfast, and free wifi
reviews.title: A little faded from past glories, but a fantastic location

reviews.text: Only downer was the lack of availability of ironing services - I had work shirts that I needed to iron after unpacking, and couldn't borrow an iron. I had to put the shirts through their laundry service which was irritating.
reviews.title: A good hotel, in a great location at the right $$$

reviews.text: I was in Rome on business for 6 days and stayed at the 4 star Hotel Quirinale. The location, for me was excellent. It was near the center of Rome, 1 block from a main metro station and 2 blocks from the train station. Easy to walk to all of the monuments in Rome, Trevi Fountain, Piazza Navona, Spanish Steps even the Vatican. The good part was it was on Via Nazionale which is loaded with everyday shopping (not the stuff you can't afford like on the via Condotti).
reviews.title: Returning to the Hotel Quirinale for the last ten years

description: The Hotel Quirinale, a beautiful 4-star hotel located in the heart of Rome, is near the major highlights of the city. Period furniture, valuable fabrics and original oil paintings decorate the spacious public rooms and lounges. The 209elegant rooms and suites are fully equipped with every modern comfort.Free WI-FI connection in all public areas and in each room.It is the ideal place to spend an unforgettable stay, both for families and business people. Conventions, meetings and receptions in a welcoming atmosphere – adjoining meeting rooms adaptable to any request with advanced technology and professional staff.Guests can experience the best of Italian cuisine at our Rossini Restaurant or a light snack at the Green Bar, during Spring and Summer months in the peace of our private garden.The history of the Hotel Quirinale is indissolubly linked to the adjoining Opera House, connected to the hotel by a direct passage.
